wcag_criteria.title: 1.1.1 Non-text Content
wcag_criteria.summary: All non-text content must have a text alternative, except for specific cases such as decoration, tests, and CAPTCHA.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.2.1 Audio-only and Video-only (Prerecorded)
wcag_criteria.summary: Provide alternative for prerecorded audio-only and video-only content.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.2.2 Captions (Prerecorded)
wcag_criteria.summary: Captions are required for prerecorded audio content in synchronized media.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.2.3 Audio Description or Media Alternative (Prerecorded)
wcag_criteria.summary: An alternative for time-based media or audio description is provided for prerecorded video.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.2.4 Captions (Live)
wcag_criteria.summary: Captions are provided for all live audio content in synchronized media.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.2.5 Audio Description (Prerecorded)
wcag_criteria.summary: Audio description is provided for prerecorded video content in synchronized media.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.2.6 Sign Language (Prerecorded)
wcag_criteria.summary: Sign language interpretation is provided for prerecorded audio content in synchronized media.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.2.7 Extended Audio Description (Prerecorded)
wcag_criteria.summary: Extended audio description is provided for prerecorded video when standard audio descriptions are insufficient.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.2.8 Media Alternative (Prerecorded)
wcag_criteria.summary: Alternative for time-based media is provided for all prerecorded synchronized media and video-only content.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.2.9 Audio-only (Live)
wcag_criteria.summary: An alternative for time-based media is provided for live audio-only content.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships
wcag_criteria.summary: Information and structure must be programmatically determinable or available in text.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.3.2 Meaningful Sequence
wcag_criteria.summary: Content presented in a meaningful sequence can be programmatically determined.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.3.3 Sensory Characteristics
wcag_criteria.summary: Instructions do not rely solely on sensory characteristics such as shape, color, size, or sound.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.3.4 Orientation
wcag_criteria.summary: Content does not restrict view and operation to a single orientation unless essential.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.3.5 Identify Input Purpose
wcag_criteria.summary: The purpose of input fields collecting user information is programmatically determinable.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.3.6 Identify Purpose
wcag_criteria.summary: The purpose of UI components can be programmatically determined.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.4.1 Use of Color
wcag_criteria.summary: Color is not used as the only visual means of conveying information or prompting a response.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.4.2 Audio Control
wcag_criteria.summary: A mechanism is available to stop or control audio that plays automatically for more than 3 seconds.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.4.3 Contrast (Minimum)
wcag_criteria.summary: Text and images of text must have a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.4.4 Resize Text
wcag_criteria.summary: Text can be resized without assistive technology up to 200% without loss of content or functionality.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.4.5 Images of Text
wcag_criteria.summary: Text is used to convey information rather than images of text, except in specific cases.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.4.6 Contrast (Enhanced)
wcag_criteria.summary: Text and images of text have a contrast ratio of at least 7:1.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.4.7 Low or No Background Audio
wcag_criteria.summary: Audio-only content has no background sounds, or background sounds are at least 20 decibels lower than the foreground.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.4.8 Visual Presentation
wcag_criteria.summary: Blocks of text have mechanisms for adjusting visual presentation such as color and spacing.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.4.9 Images of Text (No Exception)
wcag_criteria.summary: Images of text are only used for decoration or where a specific presentation is essential.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.4.10 Reflow
wcag_criteria.summary: Content can be presented without loss of information or functionality, and without requiring scrolling in two dimensions.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.4.11 Non-text Contrast
wcag_criteria.summary: Non-text content and UI components must have a contrast ratio of at least 3:1 against adjacent colors.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.4.12 Text Spacing
wcag_criteria.summary: Text spacing can be adjusted without loss of content or functionality.

wcag_criteria.title: 1.4.13 Content on Hover or Focus
wcag_criteria.summary: Content that appears on hover or focus must be dismissible and persistent.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.1.1 Keyboard
wcag_criteria.summary: All functionality must be operable through a keyboard interface without specific timing requirements.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.1.2 No Keyboard Trap
wcag_criteria.summary: Keyboard focus can be moved away from components using a keyboard interface.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.1.3 Keyboard (No Exception)
wcag_criteria.summary: All functionality must be operable through a keyboard interface without timing exceptions.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.1.4 Character Key Shortcuts
wcag_criteria.summary: Single-key shortcuts can be turned off or remapped.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.2.1 Timing Adjustable
wcag_criteria.summary: Time limits are adjustable, can be turned off, or users are warned before time expires.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.2.2 Pause, Stop, Hide
wcag_criteria.summary: Users can pause, stop, or hide moving or auto-updating content.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.2.3 No Timing
wcag_criteria.summary: Timing is not an essential part of events, except for real-time and synchronized media.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.2.4 Interruptions
wcag_criteria.summary: Interruptions can be postponed or suppressed, except for emergencies.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.2.5 Re-authenticating
wcag_criteria.summary: Re-authenticating does not cause data loss.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.2.6 Timeouts
wcag_criteria.summary: Users are warned about inactivity timeouts that could cause data loss.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.3.1 Three Flashes or Below Threshold
wcag_criteria.summary: Content does not flash more than three times per second unless it is below the flash threshold.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.3.2 Three Flashes
wcag_criteria.summary: Content does not flash more than three times per second.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.3.3 Animation from Interactions
wcag_criteria.summary: Users can disable motion animation triggered by interaction.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.4.1 Bypass Blocks
wcag_criteria.summary: A mechanism is available to bypass blocks of repeated content.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.4.2 Page Titled
wcag_criteria.summary: Web pages have titles that describe their topic or purpose.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.4.3 Focus Order
wcag_criteria.summary: The focus order must preserve meaning and operability.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.4.4 Link Purpose (In Context)
wcag_criteria.summary: The purpose of each link can be determined from the link text or its context.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.4.5 Multiple Ways
wcag_criteria.summary: More than one way is available to locate a web page within a set of pages, except in sequential steps.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.4.6 Headings and Labels
wcag_criteria.summary: Headings and labels describe the topic or purpose.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.4.7 Focus Visible
wcag_criteria.summary: Keyboard focus is visible for all user interface elements.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.4.8 Location
wcag_criteria.summary: Users can determine their location within a set of web pages.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.4.9 Link Purpose (Link Only)
wcag_criteria.summary: The purpose of each link can be determined from the link text alone.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.4.10 Section Headings
wcag_criteria.summary: Section headings are used to organize content.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.4.11 Focus Not Obscured (Minimum)
wcag_criteria.summary: The focused component is not hidden by content created by the author.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.4.12 Focus Not Obscured (Enhanced)
wcag_criteria.summary: No part of the focused component is hidden by content created by the author.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.4.13 Focus Appearance
wcag_criteria.summary: Focus indicators must be clearly visible and have sufficient contrast.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.5.1 Pointer Gestures
wcag_criteria.summary: Multipoint gestures can be operated with a single pointer unless essential.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.5.2 Pointer Cancellation
wcag_criteria.summary: Pointer input actions must be cancellable or abortable.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.5.3 Label in Name
wcag_criteria.summary: The visible label of a component matches its programmatic name.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.5.4 Motion Actuation
wcag_criteria.summary: Functionality that can be operated by motion can also be operated by UI elements.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.5.5 Target Size (Enhanced)
wcag_criteria.summary: Pointer input targets are at least 44 by 44 CSS pixels.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.5.6 Concurrent Input Mechanisms
wcag_criteria.summary: Web content does not restrict input modalities available on a platform.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.5.7 Dragging Movements
wcag_criteria.summary: Functionality that uses dragging can be operated without dragging unless essential.

wcag_criteria.title: 2.5.8 Target Size (Minimum)
wcag_criteria.summary: Pointer input targets are at least 24 by 24 CSS pixels, with exceptions.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.1.1 Language of Page
wcag_criteria.summary: The default human language of each web page can be programmatically determined.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.1.2 Language of Parts
wcag_criteria.summary: The human language of each passage or phrase can be programmatically determined.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.1.3 Unusual Words
wcag_criteria.summary: A mechanism is available for identifying definitions of unusual or restricted words.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.1.4 Abbreviations
wcag_criteria.summary: A mechanism is available for identifying abbreviations.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.1.5 Reading Level
wcag_criteria.summary: Supplemental content is available for text requiring reading ability more advanced than lower secondary education level.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.1.6 Pronunciation
wcag_criteria.summary: A mechanism is available for identifying the pronunciation of words where meaning is ambiguous.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.2.1 On Focus
wcag_criteria.summary: When a component receives focus, it does not change the context.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.2.2 On Input
wcag_criteria.summary: Changing a UI component does not change the context without user awareness.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.2.3 Consistent Navigation
wcag_criteria.summary: Navigational mechanisms occur in the same order on all pages.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.2.4 Consistent Identification
wcag_criteria.summary: Components that have the same functionality are consistently identified.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.2.5 Change on Request
wcag_criteria.summary: Changes of context are only initiated by user request.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.2.6 Consistent Help
wcag_criteria.summary: Help mechanisms are presented in the same order across pages.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.3.1 Error Identification
wcag_criteria.summary: Input errors are identified and described to the user in text.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.3.2 Labels or Instructions
wcag_criteria.summary: Labels or instructions are provided when user input is required.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.3.3 Error Suggestion
wcag_criteria.summary: Suggestions for correction are provided when input errors are detected.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.3.4 Error Prevention (Legal, Financial, Data)
wcag_criteria.summary: For pages that involve legal commitments, submissions are reversible, checked, and confirmed.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.3.5 Help
wcag_criteria.summary: Context-sensitive help is available.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.3.6 Error Prevention (All)
wcag_criteria.summary: Submissions are reversible, checked, and confirmed for all web pages that require user input.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.3.7 Redundant Entry
wcag_criteria.summary: Information previously entered by the user is auto-populated or selectable.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.3.8 Accessible Authentication (Minimum)
wcag_criteria.summary: Authentication processes do not require cognitive tests unless an alternative method is provided.

wcag_criteria.title: 3.3.9 Accessible Authentication (Enhanced)
wcag_criteria.summary: Cognitive function tests in authentication are not required, or alternatives are provided.

wcag_criteria.title: 4.1.1 Parsing
wcag_criteria.summary: Elements must have complete start and end tags, be nested correctly, and not contain duplicate attributes.

wcag_criteria.title: 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value
wcag_criteria.summary: UI components must have their name, role, and value programmatically determined.

wcag_criteria.title: 4.1.3 Status Messages
wcag_criteria.summary: Status messages can be programmatically determined and presented to assistive technologies.
